Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of an orange-red pottery vessel, the fabric is relatively coarse and black in section, both the interior and exterior bear traces of a light-brown slip, with remains of one lines of Coptic text written in black ink on the exterior and a further four lines of text on the interior, now smudged and faded in parts.
Curator's comments: To be published by J. Cromwell
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393211) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393211)
